title: PM Modi bats for local languages in courts, CJI Ramana reminds judges of ‘Lakshman Rekha’ - The Indian Express
content:
1. PM Modi bats for local languages in courts, CJI Ramana reminds judges of ‘Lakshman Rekha’  The Indian Express
  2. Centre Abolished 1,450 'Irrelevant' Laws, Only 75 Of Them Abolished By States: PM Modi To CMs, Chief Justices  ABP Live
  3. 'Should promote local languages in courts': PM's top quotes at key Delhi event  Hindustan Times
  4. CJI Ramana Requests Chief Justices Of High Courts With Vacancies To Forward Names For Elevations Soon  Live Law - Indian Legal News
  5. CJI Ramana: 126 vacancies filled in under a year, 50 appointments soon  The Indian Express
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: On the issue of repealing obsolete laws, PM Modi said states have been lagging behind when it comes to addressing this issue. While the Centre has nixed 1,450 obsolete laws over the last seven years, states have only repealed 75, he informed.
